1.text: Fill a bowl with hot tap water and a few drops of dish soap.
1.vid: /3/36/Clean a Glass Top Stove Step 8 Version 3.360p.mp4

2.text: Submerge a soft, microfiber towel into the soap and water mixture.
2.vid: /3/38/Clean a Glass Top Stove Step 9 Version 3.360p.mp4

3.text: Sprinkle a thick layer of baking soda over the stove.
3.vid: /5/5a/Clean a Glass Top Stove Step 10 Version 3.360p.mp4

4.text: Remove the towel and wring it out.
4.vid: /c/c9/Clean a Glass Top Stove Step 11 Version 3.360p.mp4

5.text: Lay the towel on the stove and wait at least 15 minutes.

6.text: Scrub the stovetop with the towel.

7.text: Remove any remaining baking soda and water residue.

8.text: Scrape away any remaining debris with a graspable razor blade.

10.text: Pour or spray the liquid onto the stove.
10.vid: /1/19/Clean a Glass Top Stove Step 5 Version 3.360p.mp4

11.vid: /4/48/Clean a Glass Top Stove Step 6 Version 3.360p.mp4

12.text: Use a razor blade with a handle to scrape off any remaining food.

13.vid: /6/6d/Clean a Glass Top Stove Step 7 Version 3.360p.mp4

15.text: Scrub the stove with soapy water once a week.
